title: Check service ID of transaction before accepting to mempool [ECR-3816]
body:
**New changes:**

- Many consensus-related methods of `NodeHandler` are made private.
- Consensus rules are now forbid adding transactions for which `BlockchainMut::check_tx` failed to the block. In particular, that means the following:
  1. Invalid transaction hashes are stored into temporary in-memory set for node to be able to lookup for it without storing it in the persistent memory.
  2. If block propose contains transaction known as invalid, node won't send prevote for it.
  3. If majority of the nodes will decide to approve the block with transaction known as invalid, node will panic (because it's either node implementation bug, or majority of nodes work incorrectly).
  4. If node lagging behind receives a committed block with the incorrect transaction, it panics as well.
- Sandbox tests are added to cover cases 3 and 4 from the list above.

-----

This PR introduces a quasi-new method `check_tx`, which performs some checks on tx before accepting it to the mempool.

Currently, the only check there is correctness of the destination, but later it (hopefully) will be extended with more mature validation.

Since we sort-of had this functionality in 0.12, I guess changelog shouldn't be updated here.

title: Make DispatcherSchema merkelized again [ECR-3810]
body:
It seems that business logic in dispatcher became very complex because there is a two different ways to deploy artifacts and start services.

* During the normal block execution.
* During the execution of genesis block.

We have to eliminate special case for genesis block to make code simpler.

title: Update changelog [ECR-3516]
body:
Hooray, I guess?

Once this gets merged, feel free to turn on your "please-update-a-changelog"-o-meter.

[A link to the rendered version of `CHANGELOG.md`](https://github.com/popzxc/exonum/blob/update-changelog/CHANGELOG.md)

This update schema:
- This is not a complete migration guide / documentation. Only a short description was added with links to the docs/examples.
- Missing changelog entries for non-dymanic-services changes were added.
- For dynamic services, a four-level description is given:
  1. A short overview.
  2. A short migration guide (not really a guide, more of "where you can find the info" section).
  3. A list of important PRs within implementing the feature.
  4. A list of ALL PRs related to this feature. "Garbage" PRs (e.g. "merge master") are filtered out. However, PRs from `3` are included.
- __Important:__ Inserted links are adapted for the release. They refer to the 0.13 release artifacts, so they don't work now, but will become correct on the release.

title: Harsher naming restrictions in MerkleDB APIs [ECR-3834]
body: Deny using dot in prefixes and service names.

title: Remove max-builtin-id constant [ECR-3851]
body:
**Update:** As @slowli suggested, entry with max builtin instance id was removed and instead public access to the running service list was gained in the Dispatcher.

To ensure that method with `pub` visibility won't leak a mutable access to the dispatcher schema, this method exists only for `ReadonlyFork<'_>` specialization.

---

This PR removes `MAX_BUILTIN_INSTANCE_ID`, introducing the following approach:
- During initialization, `Dispatcher` checks builtin IDs, finding the highest one, and storing it in the entry.
- Within the first dynamic service start, `Supervisor` checks that entry of `Dispatcher`, and assigns the ID as the next to the max builtin ID, initializing its own entry `vacant_instance_id`.
- Since that, IDs are assigned sequentially using `vacant_instance_id` entry.

Such an approach supports sparse builtin instance ID spaces, which may be helpful, i.e., when user has three builtin instances with IDs 0, 1 and 2, but then decides to remove instance with ID 1 from code -- nothing will break then.

title: Remove isolate method [ECR-3820]
body:
We either apply the config with all the changes, or don't apply it at all.
So the `isolate` method is not required anymore.

Slippery moments:
- We still have to panic to rollback changes (will be fixed once we'll be able to return an error in `before_commit`).
- If panic/error occurs during config applying, the proposal is not removed (well, in fact it's removed but then rolled back). However I've added a check in the config proposal tx for it, so it's not a big problem I guess.

title: Restore warn(missing_docs) in the Exonum crate [ECR-3821]
Supervisor modes [ECR-3794] [ECR-3771]
body:
## Description

This PR modifies the `Supervisor` entity such that it's now able to work in either `Simple` or `Decentralized` mode.

The difference between these modes is in the decision-making algorithm:
- Within simple mode, the amount of checks performed by the Supervisor
  is reduced to the minimum: the only requirement is that every request is sent
  by the validator.
- Within decentralized mode, policy on requests is the following:
  deploy requests should be signed and sent by every validator,
  config proposals should be approved by at least (2/3+1) validators.

New "Mode" mechanism is pretty flexible, it allows us to implement different supervisor quite easily if needed (for example, supervisor that don't require deploy request to be sent to every validator, but requires a byzantine quorum for configs).

`Simple` mode is chosen as default one, thus allowing to deploy&init services with a simpler workflow (no more need to send requests to every validator).

## Also

Also, this PR introduces the following changes:
- Allows generic structs to derive `ServiceFactory`.
- `SimpleSupervisor` is removed since it's not needed anymore.
- Tests for `SimpleSupervisor` that duplicate already implemented tests for `Supervisor` are removed. Only tests for simple mode related logic are kept.
- `StartService` is merged into `ConfigPropose` transaction (which means that for `Decentralized` mode byzantine quorum is used).
- `deadline_height` is removed from `StartService`, since it's a part of `ConfigPropose` which contains `actual_from`.
- `actual_from` field is now optional: if it's set to 0, it'll be considered a next height (it's especially useful for simple mode, since we don't anymore have to deduce applicable height).
- `ConfigPropose` now contains `configuration_number` field to avoid conflicting configuration changes based on the same original config.
- A new private endpoint `configuration-number` is introduced, allowing us to get amount of the processed configurations.

title: Update websocket requirement from 0.23 to 0.24
body:
Updates the requirements on [websocket](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket) to permit the latest version.
Commits - [`d516fba`](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/commit/d516fba499ce55c5869ab39abc14156001dab637) Try fixing the build - [`a14c7ef`](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/commit/a14c7ef78f01c8d211ad75dcd4f69c3499e5a660) Bump version in README - [`a197d5f`](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/commit/a197d5ffd43a586dcbe080c2c454abc465d2d1d5) Re-pin nightly version for tests, no clippy for now - [`80313df`](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/commit/80313df6bda43c68c754eef2542b54c9ab18f01c) cargo fmt - [`e1b811c`](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/commit/e1b811cd4eb5871dfdfc06ec4de9fe61e30d6c3b) Bump version to 0.24.0 - [`0b51f58`](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/commit/0b51f5866ca7ec48dba3821e840a7c6f492b99df) Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/master' into split_in_two - [`b3e3970`](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/commit/b3e39709497e69812e71a15d40991f9698c75134) Elaborate comment in websocket-base - [`10dbb8c`](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/commit/10dbb8c82ffc7e98850dced99a8a97c0b1aa6280) Rename websocket-lowlevel to websocket-base - [`d6f715e`](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/commit/d6f715ed89bc5935ed4bbeebf8163a908f0c6bcb) Additional comment - [`9e98df3`](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/commit/9e98df32df02e27392c9e093fcd1f6883c5c8154) Merge pull request [#244](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/issues/244) from najamelan/async_client_example/dont_close_twice - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/compare/v0.23.0...v0.24.0)

Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot badge me` will comment on this PR with code to add a "Dependabot enabled" badge to your readme Additionally, you can set the following in your Dependabot [dashboard](https://app.dependabot.com): - Update frequency (including time of day and day of week) - Pull request limits (per update run and/or open at any time) - Automerge options (never/patch/minor, and dev/runtime dependencies) - Out-of-range updates (receive only lockfile updates, if desired) - Security updates (receive only security updates, if desired)

title: ProofMapIndex variants for hashed and raw keys [ECR-3777]
body:
New variant of the `ProofMapIndex` have been introduced - `RawProofMapIndex`. It is used for keys that maps directly to `ProofPath`, for example `Hash` and  `PublicKey`. By default `ProofMapIndex` is used for keys that implements `ObjectsHash`.
Also removed `ObjectHash` implementation for [u8; 32].

Differentiated access to database [ECR-3760] [ECR-3768] [ECR-3769]
body:
## Overview

This PR introduces read-only access to forks, differentiates read-only and full access to indexes, and maps these changes to the blockchain access API.

### Bikeshedding targets

- Names of methods, e.g., in `merkledb::AccessExt` (`list` or `get_list`? `ensure_map` or `get_or_create_map` or something else entirely?) and `BlockchainData`.
- Whether `AccessExt` makes sense in general (vs having public index constructors).
- Whether it was a correct decision to remove references to indexes and `ObjectAccess`.
- Lazy vs eager creation of indexes in schemas, its impact on performance and UX.

### More important stuff

- How much does this break EJB?

### Definition of Done

- [ ] There are no TODOs left in the merged code

title: Remove ApiContext structure [ECR-3745]
body:
## Overview

This method removes `ApiContext` structure and replaces its usage with `Blockchain`, since their layout became the same.

**Also**, this PR reduces the visibility of the `Blockchain::into_mut` method, since it's not really clear that this method should be called only once, and it's easy to misuse it (e.g. one can try to obtain the `Fork` with that method, which is completely incorrect).
However, that doesn't affect the public interface, since this method is just a sugar for (also public) `BlockchainBuilder`.

title: Add anonymous lifetimes [ECR-3757]
body:
## Overview

<!-- Please describe your changes here 
  and list any open questions you might have. -->

See: https://jira.bf.local/browse/ECR-3757
<!-- markdownlint-enable MD034 -->

### Definition of Done

- [ ] There are no TODOs left in the merged code
- [ ] Change is covered by automated tests
- [ ] Benchmark results are attached (if applicable)
- [ ] The [coding guidelines] are followed
- [ ] Public API has proper documentation
- [ ] Changelog is updated if needed (in case of notable or breaking changes)
- [ ] The continuous integration build passes

[coding guidelines]: https://github.com/exonum/exonum/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#conventions
